Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.util

Class EnvManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.util.EnvManager
  • public class EnvManager
extends Object
    Simple utility class wrapping System.getenv(). EnvManager instances come in three different flavours, according to how they read environment variables (see EnvManager.EmptyValue). All flavours are pre-instantiated, so there is no extra cost associated with using different flavours for different environment variables.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  EnvManager.EmptyValue
      Specifies how to treat environment variables that are present but have no value.

      Returns an EnvManager instance that uses the specified strategy.

      Returns an Optional containing the value of the specified environment variable or an empty Optional if there is no environment variable with the specified name.

      Returns the value of the specified environment variable or a default value if there is no environment variable with the specified name.

      Returns an Optional containing the boolean value of the specified environment variable or an empty Optional if there is no environment variable with the specified name.

      Returns the value of the specified environment variable as a boolean or a default value if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
      OptionalInt getAsInt​(String name)
      Returns an OptionalInt containing the integer value of the specified environment variable or an empty OptionalInt if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
      int getAsInt​(String name, int dfault)
      Returns the value of the specified environment variable as an integer or a default value if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
      String getRequired​(String name)
      Returns the value of the specified environment variable or throws an InvalidEnvironmentException if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
      boolean getRequiredAsBoolean​(String name)
      Returns the value of the specified environment variable as an int or throws an InvalidEnvironmentException if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
      int getRequiredAsInt​(String name)

    • Method Detail

      • envManager

        public static EnvManager envManager()
        Returns an EnvManager instance that uses the EnvManager.EmptyValue.DEFAULT strategy. Equivalent to envManager(EMPTY_IS_DEFAULT).
        Returns:
        An EnvManager instance

      • envManager

        public static EnvManager envManager​(EnvManager.EmptyValue ev)
        Returns an EnvManager instance that uses the specified strategy.
        Parameters:
        ev - The strategy to use for environment variables that are present but without value
        Returns:
        An EnvManager instance

                  String dfault)
        Returns the value of the specified environment variable or a default value if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        dfault - The value to use if the environment variable is not present
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable

      • getRequired

        public String getRequired​(String name)
                   throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns the value of the specified environment variable or throws an InvalidEnvironmentException if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If there is no environment variable with the specified name

      • getAsInt

        public OptionalInt getAsInt​(String name)
                     throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns an OptionalInt containing the integer value of the specified environment variable or an empty OptionalInt if there is no environment variable with the specified name. Parsing is substantially stricter than Integer.parseInt. See NumberMethods.asPlainInt.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        Returns:
        An OptionalInt containing the value of the environment variable or an empty OptionalInt if there is no such environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If the value of the environment variable could not be converted to an integer

      • getAsInt

        public int getAsInt​(String name,
                    int dfault)
             throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns the value of the specified environment variable as an integer or a default value if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        dfault - The value to use if the environment variable is not present
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If the value of the environment variable could not be converted to an integer

      • getRequiredAsInt

        public int getRequiredAsInt​(String name)
                     throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns the value of the specified environment variable as an int or throws an InvalidEnvironmentException if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If there is no environment variable with the specified name, or if the value of the environment variable could not be converted to an integer

      • getAsBoolean

        public Optional<Boolean> getAsBoolean​(String name)
                               throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns an Optional containing the boolean value of the specified environment variable or an empty Optional if there is no environment variable with the specified name. Parsing is somewhat stricter than Boolean.valueOf as the only valid values are "true" and "false" (ignoring case); not "true" for true and anything else for false.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If the value of the environment variable could not be converted to a boolean

      • getAsBoolean

        public boolean getAsBoolean​(String name,
                            boolean dfault)
                     throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns the value of the specified environment variable as a boolean or a default value if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        dfault - The value to use if the environment variable is not present
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If the value of the environment variable could not be converted to an integer

      • getRequiredAsBoolean

        public boolean getRequiredAsBoolean​(String name)
                             throws InvalidEnvironmentException
        Returns the value of the specified environment variable as an int or throws an InvalidEnvironmentException if there is no environment variable with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        Returns:
        The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        InvalidEnvironmentException - If there is no environment variable with the specified name, or if the value of the environment variable could not be converted to an integer
